pageContext.claim: “I think we’ve certainly done better than anybody else, and we got all those things done that I told you about, including getting our hostages back.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is unusually ungracious to his predecessors, especially considering he has only just embarked on negotiations. Bill Clinton negotiated a nuclear agreement with North Korea that froze its plutonium program and was working on a missile deal when he departed office. But that agreement fell apart under George W. Bush. But then Bush tried to negotiate a deal, even lifting sanctions on North Korea. But that deal fell apart once Obama was elected. In each case, North Korea used the arrival of a new president to wiggle out of its commitments. Other presidents also obtained the release of detainees held by North Korea.
